verses.verse: I am a rose <WH2261> of Sharon, <WH8289> a lily <WH7799> of the valleys. <WH6010> Lover
As a lily <WH7799> among thorns, <WH2336> so is my love <WH7474> among the daughters. <WH1323> Beloved

As the apple tree <WH8598> among the trees <WH6086> of the wood, <WH3293> so is my beloved <WH1730> among the sons. <WH1121> I sat <WH3427> down under his shadow <WH6738> with great delight, <WH2530> his fruit <WH6529> was sweet <WH4966> to my taste. <WH2441>
He brought <WH935> me to the banquet <WH3196> hall. <WH1004> His banner <WH1714> over me is love. <WH160>
Strengthen <WH7502> me with raisins, <WH809> refresh <WH7502> me with apples; <WH8598> For I am faint <WH2470> with love. <WH160>
His left hand <WH8040> is under my head. <WH7218> His right hand <WH3225> embraces me. <WH2263>

I adjure <WH7650> you, <WH1323> daughters of Jerusalem, <WH3389> by the roes, <WH6643> or <WH176> by the hinds <WH355> of the field, <WH7704> that you not stir up, <WH5782> nor awaken <WH5782> love, <WH160> until it so desires. <WH2654>
The voice <WH6963> of my beloved! <WH1730> Behold, <WH935> he comes, leaping <WH1801> on the mountains, <WH2022> skipping <WH7092> on the hills. <WH1389>

My beloved <WH1730> is like <WH1819> a roe <WH6643> or a young <WH6082> hart. <WH354> Behold, <WH5975> he stands behind <WH310> our wall! <WH3796> He looks <WH7688> in at the windows. <WH2474> He glances <WH6692> through the lattice. <WH2762>
My beloved <WH1730> spoke, <WH6030> and said <WH559> to me, <WH6965> "Rise up, my love, <WH7474> my beautiful one, <WH3303> and come away. <WH3212>
For, <WH5638> behold, the winter is past. <WH5674> The rain <WH1653> is over <WH2498> and gone. <WH1980>

The flowers <WH5339> appear <WH7200> on the earth. <WH776> The time <WH6256> of the singing <WH2158> has come, <WH5060> and the voice <WH6963> of the turtledove <WH8449> is heard <WH8085> in our land. <WH776>

The fig tree <WH8384> ripens <WH2590> her green figs. <WH6291> The vines <WH1612> are in blossom. <WH5563> They give <WH5414> forth their fragrance. <WH7381> Arise, <WH6965> my love, <WH7474> my beautiful one, <WH3303> and come away. <WH3212>" Lover

My dove <WH3123> in the clefts <WH2288> of the rock, <WH5553> In the hiding <WH5643> places <WH4095> of the mountainside, <WH7200> Let me see your face. <WH4758> Let me hear <WH8085> your voice; <WH6963> for your voice <WH6963> is sweet, <WH6156> and your face <WH4758> is lovely. <WH5000>
Catch <WH270> for us the foxes, <WH7776> the little <WH6996> foxes <WH7776> that spoil <WH2254> the vineyards; <WH3754> for our vineyards <WH3754> are in blossom. <WH5563> Beloved
My beloved <WH1730> is mine, <WH7462> and I am his. He browses among the lilies. <WH7799>

Until the day <WH3117> is cool, <WH6315> and the shadows <WH6752> flee away, <WH5127> turn, <WH5437> my beloved, <WH1730> and be like <WH1819> a roe <WH6643> or a young <WH6082> hart <WH354> on the mountains <WH2022> of Bether. <WH1336>
